availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathan Adams (Lawrence County, Kentucky, pilot and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, pilot and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Rosanna Adams. Father of James J. Adams. Pilot in Greenup County, Kentucky, in 1850. Convicted of keeping a tippling house in Lawrence County in 1861. Served as private in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 198A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Cattlesburg, p. 108A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0270.
KYR-0001-020-1038.
KYR-0001-004-3393.
